question: Air flows into a heat engine at ambient conditions of 100 kPa, 300 K, as shown in <image 1>. Energy is supplied as 1200 kJ per kilogram of air from a 1500 K source, and in some part of the process a heat transfer loss of 300 kJ/kg air occurs at 750 K.The air leaves the engine at 100 kPa, 800 K. Find the first- and second-law efficiencies
description: The image depicts a schematic of a heat engine system. Air enters the heat engine at ambient conditions with a pressure \( P_0 \) of 100 kPa and a temperature \( T_0 \) of 300 K. The air then undergoes a process within the heat engine where it receives energy \( q_H \) from a high-temperature source at \( T_H = 1500 \) K. During this process, there is also a heat transfer loss \( -q_{\text{loss}} \) of 300 kJ/kg air occurring at a lower temperature \( T_M = 750 \) K. The air exits the heat engine at the same pressure \( P_0 \) but at a higher temperature \( T_2 = 800 \) K. The work output from the heat engine is denoted by \( w \).
